creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Santuario releases are not being served from the ASF mirror system.

AIUI, all ASF releases MUST use the mirror system.

creator: cantor.2@osu.edu
text: They were moved to the main distribution site and the mirrors a week or so ago.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Note: the download page

http://santuario.apache.org/download.html

says:

"Source and binary distributions for both the Java and C++ libraries are available from from the  project site only. Current distributions are not available from the mirrors."

This is not actually true, as the mirrors do have the current release.

Also, there are no MD5 or SHA1 checksum files for the releases.
AIUI at least one of these is also required for all ASF releases.

The download page then needs to link to the MD5/SHA1 checksums on the main (non-mirror) server.

creator: cantor.2@osu.edu
text:
The web site is a known issue, I don't expect anything to get done there for a while, but it's tracked.

I thought the checksums were created when the files were put into place the other day. The directory isn't group writeable, will need to wait on the PMC chair to fix.

> This is not actually true, as the mirrors do have the current release.

I just added the distributions to www.apache.org/dist/santuario and archive.apache.org/dist/santuario recently. The website hasn't been updated yet to reflect this. I'm working on this at the moment.

> Also, there are no MD5 or SHA1 checksum files for the releases.
> AIUI at least one of these is also required for all ASF releases.

Previous releases of Santuario/XML-Security did not appear to create checksum files. From what I can tell this is not a strict requirement...:

http://www.apache.org/dev/release-signing.html#motivation

>> Signatures should be ASCII armored and detached.

>>Your public key should be exported and the result appended to the appropriate >> KEYS file(s).

>>That's all you need to know to sign a release.

All of these steps have been followed for the current distribution(s).

> I thought the checksums were created when the files were put into place the
> other day. 

No, I just copied the artifacts from the Santuario dist page across. Henk objected to the fact that there was no KEYS file and so the signatures could not be verified, I copied the KEYS file across to fix that.

> The directory isn't group writeable, will need to wait on the PMC chair to fix.

This is done now.

Colm.
creator: coheigea@apache.org

text:
http://www.apache.org/dev/release-signing.html#policy

says

"... must be accompanied by one file containing an OpenPGP compatible ASCII armored detached signature and another file containing an MD5 checksum."
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
> "... must be accompanied by one file containing an OpenPGP compatible ASCII
> armored detached signature and another file containing an MD5 checksum."

Understood. I will make sure that all future releases will conform with this requirement.

Colm.
creator: coheigea@apache.org

text:
AIUI, the requirement for MD5 files applies to all releases created after the rule was published, and that was some years ago.

It's trivial to create MD5 / SHA files for existing archives.

I can create them if you want.

BTW, the Forrest web-site has a good download page:

http://forrest.apache.org/mirrors.cgi
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
> It's trivial to create MD5 / SHA files for existing archives.
> I can create them if you want.

No thanks, I've taken care of it. All current and archived Santuario artifacts now have a corresponding checksum file, and should appear on the ASF mirror system whenever it sync's up.

Colm.
creator: coheigea@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
The updated download page still points to the main ASF systems, not the mirrors.

" available from the  ASF distribution directory [1] ...
In addition, all distributions are available from the  project site. [2]"

Neither [1] nor [2] should be promoted as download directories (except for KEYS and the hash files).

There are also no links to the MD5 files.

[1] http://www.apache.org/dist/santuario/
[2] http://santuario.apache.org/dist/
